Wrq: Here is your save code! Tell us in the comments if something's wrong or if you found a bug.
The code may be long, so click "see inside" if you want to copy the entirety of it.
Click or tap out to close this window.
bR`h^AQ2CxSD_B.K(7u-: dialogueText
You picked up a fire flower! All flowers allow you to throw various projectiles, in this case, fire. Press X to throw a fireball!
UNUSED
That orange object is a spring! Jump on it to bounce high! Boing!
You can jump higher when you hold the jump button. You can also dive for additional height.
UNUSED
UNUSED
Try switching characters by pausing the game (PRESS SPACE). Try switching to Luigi, who can jump higher.
Click a star to select a mission, collect more stars to unlock new worlds!
Missed something? Walk back to the left to grab it!
To access this big star, you need to collect the other power stars.
You might need to press the dive key to reach that platform.
See that block... there might be goodies in it! Break it by hitting it with your head... or your fist... I'm not sure...
UNUSED
Welcome to the village. Use the ARROW KEYS, or A and D to move Mario. Try walking to the right!
Use the UP KEY or W to jump over that pipe, use the DOWN KEY or S to dive and move faster.
Press F to use your special ability! Here, Mario gets a fire power, but each character has a different skill.
Toad¶Hey there Mario! Princess Peach is waiting for you at the castle!
Toad¶Woah... look at all the stars...
Toad¶Welcome to the Mushroom Kingdom... you knew that... right?
Luigi¶Hey there bro! Happy Mushrrom Festival!
Wario¶There are so many coins! We're rich! WAHAHAA!

Dear Mario¶Please come to the castle.¶I have something special for you.¶Princess Peach

You need more power stars to open this door!
Stuck? Try launching out of the water using momentum.
WARNING! These platforms flip on and off whenever you dive (with DOWN KEY or S).

You got an ice flower! Press X to shoot iceballs and freeze enemies, run into them to defeat them.
You got a power star!
You got a big star!

Over there is a minecart! Ride it to travel really fast! Slow it down by holding left.
You picked up... a goo flower?! Press X to shoot slime balls and stick enemies to the ground.
You can now play as Waluigi!

N.text:
0 = entry
1-4 = center
5-14 = hallway (odds = left, evens = right)
15-39 = level rooms

a9c.text:
WHAT NEEDS TO BE DONE TO FINISH CURRENT LEVELS:.
- Fantastic Falls: Add Madame Brood as a miniboss.
- Cloud Ship: Add Bowser Jr. as a boss.

a9d.text:
NEW LEVELS:

How to use:
The level progression HAS to follow the list below. Every room in the castle is designed for these levels, so don't add your own.
There already are some level graphics you could use. Check them out in the "Graphics for New Levels" project over at https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/369992445
Music should be chosen when the scralaxy is made unless otherwise specified.
Minibosses and bosses can be found by searching for them on Google, they are all Mario characters.
Please try to follow the level design, ask me (@redyoshi857) if you have any questions.

Tiki Tropic Scralaxy
Miniboss: Donkey Kong
Level Design: A tiki village on a beach, then a treehouse with a Donkey Kong-style level similar to the New Donk City Festival.

Spooky Space Scralaxy
Music: Yoshi's Island castle theme??
Level Design: A ghost house, both from the outside and inside 

Shipwreck Scralaxy
Music: Dire Dire Docks
Boss: Triclyde
Level Design: A shipwreck boss scralaxy.

Searing Sand Scralaxy
Music: NSMBU Desert Theme
Miniboss: Fryguy
Level Design: The original World 2 from 0.4.7.

Tree Maze Scralaxy
Music: Beware the Forest's Mushrooms from Super Mario RPG
Level Design: A level progression maze with a dense forest theme (like if SMW Forest of Illusion was a level)

Sweet Sweet Scralaxy
Music: Sweet Sweet Kingdom (MK8D)
Miniboss: Birdo
Level Design: A mix of Sweet Sweet Kingdom and Sweet Sweet Galaxy. Maybe a little Luncheon Kingdom mixed in?

Flashback Scralaxy
Level Design: 2-3 from SM3DL

Fire Castle Scralaxy
Music: Some Mario castle music, choice of whoever makes the scralaxy.
Boss: Bowser
Level Design: A fiery castle. 'Nuff said.

Shiver Cliff Scralaxy
Miniboss: Chief Chilly
Level Design: An ordinary snow level.

Giant Block Scralaxy
Miniboss: Goomboss
Level Design: World 4 from SMB3

Mesa Mine Scralaxy
Level Design: A gold mine underneath a mesa. Featuring a more advanced version of the Deep Delve Scralaxy minecart track

Ice Slide Scralaxy
Music: Slider from SM64
Level Design: An icy level based on sliding and racing a penguin.

Shiverburn Scralaxy
Boss: Two bosses, one for fire and one for ice
Level Design: A level with both fire and ice.

Raging Flame Scralaxy
Miniboss: Wart
Level Design: Ordinary lava level.

Metropolis Scralaxy
Music: something from Mario Kart
Level Design: A large city with big architecture and moving lights

Fire Factory Scralaxy
Miniboss: Tatanga
Level Design: A factory. Also kind of orange and filled with fire.

Moon Base Scralaxy
Music: Moon Kingdom
Level Design: A moon base, of course.

Summit Scralaxy
Music: Silence before the boss rush, then boss music, then silence after that.
Bosses: Dry Bowser, King Boo, Boolossus
Level Design: A boss rush on the volcano summit which reaches up to space. Starts with Dry Bowser who is angry at Mario for killing him, then King Boo appears and reveals he was the pilot of the UFO and the unknown force Wart and Tatanga were working with. Once he is defeated, he uses the last Grand Star to transform into Boolossus. After he is defeated, the power star is collected and the ending happens.

a9x.text: to be removed in the final version

a9y.text:
ABOUT SUPER MARIO SCRALAXY'S FILESIZE
Note that, in Scratch 3.0, each asset has to be smaller than 10mb and the .JSON file (code) can't be bigger than 5200000 bites (52 mb). 
Technically, the maximum possible size for a project is 318GB (compressed), but it is a good
idea to keep the file size for Scralaxy under 64MB (uncompressed), as anything above might not work on lower-end devices.

0.6.5:
Music (129) - 19MB
Vector (1277) - 20.5MB
Code (1) - 4.11MB
Bitmap (2) - 223KB

TOTAL - 43.9MB (uncompressed) 27.3MB (compressed)

eZ.text: Do not modify this block, and instead use it when there is a door-like transition. The transition consists of two black bars going to the edges of the screen while they disappear, and it is there to create the illusion of a door opening.

e0.text: Do not modify this block, and don't use it. It is already finished.

a%,.text:
Some information on Boss variables

Boss Health: the current boss health, managed by the on-screen boss.

Total Boss Health: the health the boss has at the beginning of the fight.

Boss ID: indicates the number of the current on-screen boss.
Handled directly by this sprite.
Values:

1 = Spearhead

aos.text:
mushroom list:
every mushroom gets added to the list, with after its name, the number of the mushrooms of the same type that were grabbed since.
